page.title: 07A T T I T U D E S
page.content: With a scattered population of approx. 120, Stanford and Orleton has a strong community spirit. The feeling of belonging is engendered by the relaxed friendly atmosphere of this part of the Teme Valley. Local activities are based at the Parish Hall which is a converted school building provided by the Winnington family and financed by parish activities. The local gatherings are varied and well-attended and social life in this community provides entertainment for young and old alike at little cost through the seasons. Harvest time is given special attention as locals deck the church with produce and after the Harvest Festival Service adjourn to the Parish Hall for a traditional supper.
